job_description: Is the Mayor of the wasteland town.

dynamic_line: I feel like I'm always swamped with work, what do you want?
Do you have anything to report? I'm a bit busy right now.
Always glad to see another face safe behind the town's walls.
I've been here for years, we have our share of problems but we're still a lot better off than most, I think.

dynamic_line.yes: It's rare to see people with a good head on their shoulders, perhaps you would be of use to me around this town?
dynamic_line.no: The walls of scrap and steel keep us safe.

dynamic_line.yes: You never know what kind of loot the scavs are going to bring in. Sometimes it's just old salsbury steak packages, sometimes it's extremely rare energy weapons from before the war!
dynamic_line.no: You seem a bit... stupid. Is there somebody else with you to help you day to day, you know, a chaperone?

dynamic_line: I heard there was a self-styled republic somewhere around named after a guy called Daniel, or was it Dave?

u_male: There's a lot of things for a guy like you do to around here, perhaps stay a while.
How has wasteland life been treating you, <name_g>
no: Has a woman like you ever considered settling down here? It's safer than most of the wasteland.
Ma'am, what do you think of the town?.

responses.text: You're the mayor of this town, right? What do you do here?
I brought your daughter back. Give her my thanks and then get back to me.
Do you have a task for me?

dynamic_line: I manage the citizenry of the town and help ensure that their daily affairs go on without incident. I also help coordinate the town guard with the local merchants and junk guild to ensure that they all have the necessary resources to do their jobs. After that, I try to maintain order around here by arbitrating disputes between quarrelsome citizens. All things considered, it's a very tiring job, but I wouldn't trade it for anything else in the world.
Thank you, this is great news! Talk to her and then get back to me, okay?

description: The town's mayor has a daughter that has recently been captured by raiders. Try and rescue her.

dialogue.describe: I need help, my daughter has recently been kidnapped by raiders who are at this location! Try and rescue her please.
dialogue.offer: Please rescue my daughter, she's been kidnapped by raiders and is being held at a location marked on your map. Please be hasty!
dialogue.accepted: Thank you, you don't know how much this means to me!
dialogue.rejected: I guess I'll need to get the guard chief to do it!
dialogue.advice: The raiders might not be initially hostile to you, so going in guns blazing might not be ideal.
dialogue.inquire: Is she safe in town yet?
dialogue.success: I cannot thank you enough, the whole town can't thank you enough!
dialogue.success_lie: I know that you're lying, why would lie about something like this!
dialogue.failure: I... I don't really know what to say.

dialogue.describe: You've already done a great service to me, but I need more help from you yet. There's a mine nearby, a mine that we want to exploit for its rare ore reserves. The problem is that a group of Wanamingos have occupied it. Suffice it to say those are nasty beasts. Kill their queen and the nest will cease to be.
dialogue.offer: You've already done a great service to me, but I need more help from you yet. There's a mine nearby, a mine that we want to exploit for its rare ore reserves. The problem is that a group of Wanamingos have occupied it. Suffice it to say those are nasty beasts. Kill their queen and the nest will cease to be.
dialogue.accepted: Thanks for accepting the offer, but do be careful out there.
dialogue.rejected: I don't blame you for rejecting, even the guard chief hates those Wanamingo creatures. You probably would've been killed anyway.
dialogue.advice: There isn't much advice I can give you besides bring a flashlight, and a *lot* of ammo. Wanamingos don't go down easy and don't need light to see, they don't even have eyes!
dialogue.success: I'm glad you made it back alive. I'll admit I wasn't expecting that. Here's your reward!
dialogue.success_lie: You're obviously lying, if you were too much of a coward to fight the Wanamingos just say so!
dialogue.failure: I guess you weren't a much for the Wanamingos. I'll have to send somebody else to do it...
